content: t w o b a l l t w i s t e r c o w l this pattern allows you to make best use of those single almost full balls of yarn you have lying around equally a great way to combine two balls of special yarn into a treasured piece this pattern works with any weight of yarn and gauge isn t too important just be sure to reduce the number of stitches you re casting on from that point on it s a case of measuring i ve used a light dk yarn throughout lana gatto cash cot whilst this involves stranded colour-work it s the easiest colour-work you ll ever do there are no charts involved with a simple 2x2 repeat and no counting a perfect introduction to stranded knitting materials - around 40g /120 metres 155 yards dk or sport weight yarn each of colour a and colour b some dk yarns come in 50g/90-100m balls it s fine to use these but you may find your cowl a little shorter alternatively think about casting on less stitches and making it a little more snug notes for this are on the next page - 3mm us 2 5 & 3 5mm us 4 60cm circular knitting needles - needle for weaving in ends - stitch marker measurements 60cm wide 24 x 21 8 5 gauge not too important 22sts width x 30sts height per 10cm squared in pattern some guidance on yarn chicken if you re a bit worried about running out of yarn weigh both of your balls before casting on start with the smallest amount first colour a as soon as this runs out you can add the final rib in colour b as b weighed more you know you ll have enough left abbreviations k knit p purl colour a k2tog knit two stitches together kfb knit front to back https //www youtube com/watch v=yyr51z6o1hm method bottom rib with smaller needles and using colour a cast on 140 stitches using the long-tail cast on method or whichever you prefer just make sure it s not too tight ifyouwouldlikeasnuggerscarf or if you have less yarn you can cast on less stitches these need to be in multiples of 4 however for example 128 / 132 / 136 place your stitch maker & join in the round work 6 row of 2x2 rib k2 p2 this should be around 2 5cm colour b with larger needles and still with colour a work one round in k until last 2 stitches k2tog 139 stitches remove the marker body with colour b k2 colour a k2 and continue until you have reached 20cm of body pattern or you ve run out of colour a there is no need to count row just stick to the x2 k sts of each colour and the pattern will magically appear before your eyes tip for colour management there isn t really a need to worry about colour dominance
